reporting_org.name: reporting_org
reporting_org.label: elements/element_json_schema.reporting_org_label
reporting_org.helper_text: Reporting Organisation data is managed via the Organisation Tab , except for value Secondary Reporter which can be managed at each activity.

ref.name: ref
ref.label: common/common.reporting_org_attributes_ref_label
ref.hover_text:
Enter the organisation’s IATI organisation identifier. If you cannot provide an identifier then you must provide the name of the organisation.

Click here for information on how to find other organisations' identifiers.

vocabulary_uri.name: vocabulary_uri
vocabulary_uri.label: elements/element_json_schema.recipient_region_attributes_vocabulary_uri_label
vocabulary_uri.hover_text: If you have selected the vocabulary ‘99 - Reporting Organisation’, provide a link to where this internal list is defined.

sector_vocabulary.name: sector_vocabulary
sector_vocabulary.label: common/common.recipient_region_attributes_region_vocabulary_label
sector_vocabulary.hover_text: Choose the codelist that you will select sectors from. IATI recommends using the OECD DAC 5-digit sector codelist. If you want to use your organisation’s own list of internal sector classifications, select the option: ‘99 - Reporting Organisation’.

percentage.name: percentage
percentage.label: elements/element_json_schema.recipient_country_attributes_percentage_label
percentage.hover_text: If you have selected more than one sector (from the same list), each sector must be given a percentage. For example, using the OECD DAC 5-digit sector codelist, you can allocate 50% of the activity's funding to ‘teacher training’ (11130) and 50% to ‘primary education’ (11220). The percentage should be a number between 0 and 100 inclusive, with no percentage sign.

tag.name: tag
tag.label: elements/element_json_schema.tag_label
tag.hover_text: You can provide other useful information about your activity by ‘tagging’ it using categorisations such as the UN Sustainable Development Goal(s). Unlike categorisations reported in the 'sector' element, tags are not associated with percentage splits on finances.

tag_vocabulary.name: tag_vocabulary
tag_vocabulary.label: common/common.recipient_region_attributes_region_vocabulary_label
tag_vocabulary.hover_text: Select the vocabulary or taxonomy used for tag classifications. You may choose to tag your activity according to an internal category list by choosing ‘99 - Reporting Organisation’.

collaboration_type.label: elements/element_json_schema.collaboration_type_label
collaboration_type.hover_text:
The type of collaboration involved in the activity’s funding disbursements, e.g. “bilateral” or “multilateral”.

Click here for more information

default_flow_type.name: default_flow_type
default_flow_type.label: common/common.activity_status_attributes_activity_status_label
default_flow_type.hover_text: If this activity’s funds can be classified by one of these options, make a selection here. This the default value for all transactions of the activity; it can be overridden for individual transactions if needed.

default_finance_type.name: default_finance_type
default_finance_type.label: common/common.activity_status_attributes_activity_status_label
default_finance_type.hover_text: Select the finance type that best applies to your activity. This the default value for all transactions of the activity; it can be overridden for individual transactions if needed.

default_aid_type.name: default_aid_type
default_aid_type.label: common/common.activity_status_attributes_activity_status_label
default_aid_type.hover_text: Select the aid type most relevant to your activity. This the default value for all transactions of the activity; it can be overridden for individual transactions if needed.

earmarking_category.name: earmarking_category
earmarking_category.label: common/common.activity_status_attributes_activity_status_label
earmarking_category.hover_text: Select the aid type most relevant to your activity. This the default value for all transactions of the activity; it can be overridden for individual transactions if needed.

earmarking_modality.name: earmarking_modality
earmarking_modality.label: common/common.activity_status_attributes_activity_status_label
earmarking_modality.hover_text: Select the aid type most relevant to your activity. This the default value for all transactions of the activity; it can be overridden for individual transactions if needed.

cash_and_voucher_modalities.name: cash_and_voucher_modalities
cash_and_voucher_modalities.label: common/common.activity_status_attributes_activity_status_label
cash_and_voucher_modalities.hover_text: Select the aid type most relevant to your activity. This the default value for all transactions of the activity; it can be overridden for individual transactions if needed.

default_tied_status.name: default_tied_status
default_tied_status.label: common/common.activity_status_attributes_activity_status_label
default_tied_status.hover_text: Select the tied status most relevant to your activity. This the default value for all transactions of the activity; it can be overridden for individual transactions if needed.

country_budget_items.name: country_budget_items
country_budget_items.label: elements/element_json_schema.country_budget_items_label
country_budget_items.hover_text:
Alignment of the activity with the functional and administrative classifications used in the recipient country’s Chart of Accounts.

Click here for more information

related_activity.name: related_activity
related_activity.label: elements/element_json_schema.related_activity_label
related_activity.hover_text:
A separately reported IATI activity that is related to this one. The ‘type’ attribute describes the type of relationship - e.g. parent, child, multifunded. Please only refer to your own activities here.

Click here for more information

condition_attached.name: condition_attached
condition_attached.label: elements/element_json_schema.conditions_attributes_condition_attached_label
condition_attached.hover_text: Select ‘True’ if your activity has a condition attached, otherwise 'False'.

legacy_data.name: legacy_data
legacy_data.label: elements/element_json_schema.legacy_data_label
legacy_data.hover_text:
You can link this activity to your organisation’s internal data and record which IATI Standard element it relates to.

Click here for more information

value.name: value
value.label: common/common.legacy_data_attributes_value_label
value.hover_text: The original value in the reporting organisation’s system

planned_disbursement.name: planned_disbursement
planned_disbursement.label: elements/element_json_schema.planned_disbursement_label
planned_disbursement.hover_text: Planned disbursements allow you to publish predefined payment schedules. They should be reported for a specific date or period, and should not replace the activity’s budget.

planned_disbursement_type.name: planned_disbursement_type
planned_disbursement_type.label: common/common.reporting_org_attributes_type_label
planned_disbursement_type.hover_text: Specify if this is an ‘original’ planned disbursement (prepared when the original commitment was made) or has subsequently been ‘revised’.

ref.name: ref
ref.label: common/common.reporting_org_attributes_ref_label
ref.hover_text:
Enter the organisation’s IATI organisation identifier. If you cannot provide an organisation identifier then you must provide the name of the organisation.

Click here for information on how to find other organisations' identifiers.

ref.name: ref
ref.label: common/common.reporting_org_attributes_ref_label
ref.hover_text:
Enter the organisation’s IATI organisation identifier. If you cannot provide an organisation identifier then you must provide the name of the organisation.

Click here for information on how to find other organisations' identifiers.

organization_role.name: organization_role
organization_role.label: common/common.participating_org_attributes_organization_role_label
organization_role.hover_text: Select an option that describes the organisation’s role in the activity.

ref.name: ref
ref.label: common/common.reporting_org_attributes_ref_label
ref.hover_text:
Enter the organisation’s IATI organisation identifier. If you cannot provide an organisation identifier then you must provide the name of the organisation.

Click here for information on how to find other organisations' identifiers.

crs_channel_code.name: crs_channel_code
crs_channel_code.label: elements/element_json_schema.participating_org_attributes_crs_channel_code_label
crs_channel_code.hover_text:
Under CRS++ Reporting Directives, this code identifies the implementing agency. Codes ending in ‘00’ are generic and are similar to the OrganisationType code.

Click here for more information

budget.name: budget
budget.label: elements/element_json_schema.budget_label
budget.hover_text:
The value of the activity’s budget for each financial quarter or year over the lifetime of the activity.

Click here for more information

vocabulary.name: vocabulary
vocabulary.label: common/common.recipient_region_attributes_region_vocabulary_label
vocabulary.hover_text: Select the results framework that your indicator is included in. If the results framework is not listed, select ‘99 - Reporting Organisation’.

year.name: year
year.label: elements/element_json_schema.indicator_sub_elements_baseline_attributes_year_label
year.hover_text: Provide the year when the indicator’s baseline was measured.

date.name: date
date.label: common/common.document_link_sub_elements_document_date_attributes_date_label
date.hover_text: Provide the date when the indicator’s baseline was measured.

name.name: name
name.label: common/common.reporting_org_sub_elements_narrative_label
name.hover_text: Enter a description of the category being disaggregated. For example, an activity could declare the dimension’s name as ‘sex’, with a value of ‘female’.

name.name: name
name.label: common/common.reporting_org_sub_elements_narrative_label
name.hover_text: Enter a description of the category being disaggregated. For example, an activity could declare the dimension’s name as ‘sex’, with a value of ‘female’.

name.name: name
name.label: common/common.reporting_org_sub_elements_narrative_label
name.hover_text: Enter a description of the category being disaggregated. For example, an activity could declare the dimension’s name as ‘sex’, with a value of ‘female’.

reference.name: reference
reference.label: common/common.reporting_org_attributes_ref_label
reference.hover_text: You can provide a reference that you use to identify this transaction in your organisation’s internal financial management system

organization_identifer_code.name: organization_identifier_code
organization_identifer_code.label: common/common.reporting_org_attributes_ref_label
organization_identifer_code.hover_text:
Enter the organisation’s IATI organisation identifier. If you cannot provide an identifier then you must provide the name of the organisation.

Click here for information on how to find other organisations' identifiers.

sector_vocabulary.name: sector_vocabulary
sector_vocabulary.label: common/common.recipient_region_attributes_region_vocabulary_label
sector_vocabulary.hover_text: Choose the codelist that you will select sectors from. IATI recommends using the OECD DAC 5-digit sector codelist. If you want to use your organisation’s own list of internal sector classifications, select the option: ‘99 - Reporting Organisation’.

code.name: code
code.label: common/common.activity_status_attributes_activity_status_label
code.hover_text: Select the sector that the transaction’s funds are supporting. You must only choose one sector from each list that you use.

text.name: text
text.label: common/common.activity_status_attributes_activity_status_label
text.hover_text: Select the sector that the transaction’s funds are supporting. You must only choose one sector from each list that you use.

category_code.name: category_code
category_code.label: common/common.activity_status_attributes_activity_status_label
category_code.hover_text: Select the sector that the transaction’s funds are supporting. You must only choose one sector from each list that you use.

sdg_goal.name: sdg_goal
sdg_goal.label: common/common.activity_status_attributes_activity_status_label
sdg_goal.hover_text: Select the sector that the transaction’s funds are supporting. You must only choose one sector from each list that you use.

sdg_target.name: sdg_target
sdg_target.label: common/common.activity_status_attributes_activity_status_label
sdg_target.hover_text: Select the sector that the transaction’s funds are supporting. You must only choose one sector from each list that you use.

vocabulary_uri.name: vocabulary_uri
vocabulary_uri.label: common/common.sector_attributes_vocabulary_uri_label
vocabulary_uri.hover_text: If you have selected the vocabulary ‘99 - Reporting Organisation’, provide a link to where this internal list is defined.
